After receiving the product, I opened the package to review its contents.  The hood looked a little wider than anticipated.  Also, since my oven was curved, I wondered how the hood would look.  So I placed the hood up to the oven to see how it would look (with the bracket as well).  No mechanical fastening took place; just lifted it up to the oven to have my wife view how it looked.  It did not look good and we concluded it would be a safety issue for our young child and elderly parent.After requesting the return policies the very next day via email, I received a response email and was notified about the stringent return guidelines (for the first time).  Essentially, one cannot even open the package and touch the hood.  I'm exaggerating, but essentially the company noted any scratch whatsoever would void the any refund.After reading the email and the attached photos, I called to find out if this was really happening.  The gentleman repeating their policy, noting that even if the unit is not mechanically fastened/installed, it did not matter.  Even putting the hood into the bracket on a table would void the refund as the hood would be "scratched" (although could not be visible because the "scratched" portion would be in the bracket and hidden).  Regardless, I noted I did not know of this stringent return policy to which he noted it was on the website.  I noted I did not see it and that, at a minimum, it should have been with the instructions or somewhere in the box as is common practice.  Not everyone looks for return policies on websites, especially since most people visit websites to place orders.So, after having to pay about $30 to return the hood and another $10-$20 (don't remember), I just received the hood back.  FYI, it took almost 4 weeks from the date I returned it.My recommendation to avoid any future issues:  place the stringent return policies in the box along with the installation instructions.  If this would add to your costs, I would recommend replacing IT for the advertisement you place in the box for a free hood in exchange for a Youtube video; at least put the ad in regular stock paper in lieu of the heavy card stock.  No added costs would be incurred and the consumer would be protected.  Had I known of this stringent return policy, I would never have placed the hood into the bracket (by hand on my table).  BTW, I keep using the word stringent because I am a SME (subject matter expert); I've been in quality control for years (most of my tenure at the corporate level).

Review.Titre: Amazing product, could use a slight redesign on how solid the mounting is.

I decided to drill out a bar existing on the microwave, install 3 m6 rivnuts and then enlarged the holes through everything in order to really get a solid mount.  I had some left over automotive m6 bolts with a philips drive, which made it possible to install without having to modify the provided mounting bar much.  My wife and I are a bit accident prone and we've already bumped the hood a few times, I'm really happy with how solid it is now.

The hood was very well packaged and arrived very quickly. It was in perfect condition, lightweight, easy to handle, and I was able to install it in a few minutes. I have had it for a few weeks now and have to say it works very well. It's keeping my microwave and upper cabinets clean. I pulled my microwave fan filters to clean after using for a week or so and they do seem to be pulling in a lot more grease. I have also noticed that the underside of the hood has grease and condensation spots so it is working to keep cooking steam more contained. Does it keep everything contained?
